title: Mount Krokisius
text: Mount Krokisius () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> 0.6 nautical miles (1.1 km) northeast of <a href="Moltke%20Harbor">Moltke Harbor</a>, <a href="South%20Georgia%20Island">South Georgia</a>. Named by the German group of the <a href="International%20Polar%20Year">International Polar Year</a> Investigations, 1882–83, for <a href="Corvette%20Captain%20Krokisius">Corvette Captain Krokisius</a>, commander of the Marie, one of the two ships of the expedition.
